entries.meaning: The state of not being used; neglect.
examples: The garden fell into disuse and became overgrown.

verbs.description: disuse (third-person singular simple present disuses, present participle disusing, simple past and past participle disused)

examples: Whether in process of time Shakspeare grew weary of the bondage of rhyme, or whether he became convinced of its impropriety in a dramatick dialogue, his neglect of rhyming (for he never wholly disused it) seems to have been gradual.
He was disused to hard work.
